intro: Chomelia tetramera, commonly known as the four-rayed chomelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows as an herb or shrub and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
